intro: Astragalus dsharfi, commonly known as the Dsharfi milkvetch, is a perennial herb native to Central Asia. It belongs to the legume family, Fabaceae, and is characterized by its compound leaves and small, pea-like flowers. The plant typically grows in dry, rocky habitats and is adapted to arid conditions. It has a deep root system that helps it survive in nutrient-poor soils. Astragalus dsharfi is also valued for its potential medicinal properties in traditional medicine.
